stem: Which of the following is NOT a cause for unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia in a neonate?
disc:
The most common cause of pathological indirect hyperbilirubinemia is due to hemolytic processes. It can result from
- ABO incompatibility
- Inherited cell membrane defects (hereditary spherocytosis and elliptocytosis)
- Erythrocyte enzyme defects (G6PD deficiency)
- Sepsis

In contrast, in biliary atresia, there is a congenital narrowing or absence of the bile duct. It also presents shortly after birth with conjugated hyperbilirubinemia.
